{"pk": 25, "path": "00010001000B0001", "depth": 4, "numchild": 0, "title": "Data-driven health and care technology", "draft_title": "Data-driven health and care technology", "slug": "data-driven-health-and-care-technology", "content_type": 33, "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": false, "url_path": "/home/key-tools-and-info/data-driven-health-and-care-technology/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "locked_at": null, "locked_by": null, "first_published_at": "2020-04-08T07:33:44.764Z", "last_published_at": "2020-04-08T07:41:05.761Z", "latest_revision_created_at": "2020-04-08T07:41:05.698Z", "live_revision": 49, "page_links": "[]", "automatic": false, "fb_og_image": null, "fb_og_title": null, "fb_og_description": null, "twitter_card_image": null, "twitter_card_title": null, "twitter_card_alt_text": null, "twitter_card_description": null, "body": "[{\"type\": \"rich_text\", \"value\": \"

What is Artificial Intelligence?

There is no single, \\nuniversally agreed definition of Artificial Intelligence (AI), nor \\nindeed of \\u2018intelligence\\u2019. Intelligence can be defined as \\n\\u2018problem-solving\\u2019, and \\u2018an intelligent system\\u2019 as one which takes the \\nbest possible action in a given situation (Accelerating AI in health and care).

The \\u2018A\\u2019 of AI generally refers to one of the following:

  • Artificial\\n (Intelligence)\\u00a0\\u2013 makes it possible for \\u2018machines\\u2019 to learn from new \\nexperiences, adjust outputs and perform human-like tasks. It can be \\nthought of as the simulation of human intelligence and could include \\nvoice and visual recognition systems.
  • Augmented (Intelligence)\\u00a0-\\n outputs that complement human intelligence, emphasising AI\\u2019s \\nsupplementary role. Examples include tools that support radiologists in \\nreviewing large numbers of scans, or that support theatre managers to \\nbetter manage theatre schedules.
  • Ambient (Intelligence)\\u00a0- the \\napplication of several technologies (including Artificial or Augmented \\nIntelligence, but also sensor networks, user interfaces, home automation\\n systems, etc) to create proactive \\u2018smart\\u2019 environments.

Why Artificial Intelligence (AI)?

Artificially\\n Intelligent Systems can carry out or augment health and care tasks that\\n have until now been completed by humans, or have not been possible \\npreviously. AI presents significant opportunities for saving money, \\nimproving care, and saving lives. For example, it could help personalise\\n NHS screening and treatments for cancer, eye disease and a range of \\nother conditions, as well as freeing up staff time.

Read some of our case studies:

  • Cogstack
  • Precision Medicine
  • EMRAD, including non-clinical (operational) applications of AI
  • Kortical

You will find more case studies at the end of our latest report\\u00a0Artificial Intelligence: how to get it right. Putting policy into practice for safe data-driven innovation in health and care.

Delete\\n

What is the future for data-driven technology in the NHS?

\\n

URL: https://youtu.be/1klENSYHXpM

\\n \\n

Provider: YouTube

\\n \\n \\n

Author: NHS England and NHS Improvement

\", \"id\": \"702812c2-5edc-4717-9f2a-d32a7f59d08b\"}, {\"type\": \"embed\", \"value\": \"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1klENSYHXpM\", \"id\": \"caa6138b-3877-4f86-828e-8d985341a425\"}, {\"type\": \"rich_text\", \"value\": \"

What is the future for data-driven technology in the NHS?

NHSX wants to support data driven technologies that have the potential to improve the quality of health and care services.


We\\n want to start with the basics and make sure that new technology \\nrespects ethical values such as autonomy, transparency, confidentiality \\nand privacy. That\\u2019s why to date we have focussed on getting the right \\nethical frameworks and standards in place so that we can better guide \\npeople.

The\\u00a0code of conduct\\u00a0(Department\\n of Health and Social Care, 2019) sets out what is expected of people \\ndeveloping, deploying and using data-driven technologies.

The NHS Artificial Intelligence laboratory

Where are we now?

NHSX\\n hasbeen working hard to understand how Artificial Intelligence (AI) is\\n currently being developed in the NHS; what the greatest opportunities \\nand risks are; and what challenges developers in this field face.

The\\n result is a report that brings together the rich insight we have \\ngathered together with some guidance for the development and deployment \\nof AI in health and care. You can\\u00a0download the full AI report as a PDF.

This report is prefaced by the foundation of knowledge obtained from the\\u00a02018 Accelerating AI in health and care: results from a state of the nation survey.

Overview of the NHS Artificial Intelligence (AI) Laboratory

The\\n NHS AI Laboratory will develop and deploy practical applications of \\nartificial intelligence in the NHS that can improve the health and \\nquality of life for our citizens. It will harness the power ofdata \\nscience and AI to turbo-charge our ability to make evidence-based \\ndecisions in health and social care.

Understanding there are\\nethical and safety concerns associated with the use of AI in health and \\ncare, the Lab will align to the core founding principles of the NHS; \\naddressing transparency, safety, privacy, explicability and bias. By \\nbuilding on the foundations already laid, such as our\\u00a0code of conduct,\\n these frameworks and best practices will ensure the project maintains \\nthe support of the public, and positions the NHS as a world leader in \\nthe development of safe and effective AI.

Through the creation of this Lab, and building on our existing work, we will:

  • provide evidence of what good practice looks like to industry and commissioners
  • reassure patients and clinicians that data-driven technology is safe, effective and maintains privacy
  • allow\\n the government to work with suppliers to guide the development of new \\ntechnology so products are suitable for the NHS in the future
  • build capability within the system with in-house expertise to prototype and develop ideas
  • make sure the NHS gets a fair deal from the commercialisation of its data resources
  • promote the UK as the best place in the world to invest in healthtech.

We will work closely with the following partners to deliver the objectives of the NHS AI Lab including but not limited to:

  • Accelerated Access Collaborative
  • Office of Life Sciences
  • Health Data Research UK
  • Department of Health and Social Care
  • The Alan Turing Institute

Artificial Intelligence in Health and Care Award

The\\n Artificial Intelligence in Health and Care Award is run by the \\nAccelerated Access Collaborative (AAC) in partnership with NHSX and the \\nNational Institute for Health Research (NIHR). It will make \\u00a3140m \\navailable over three years toaccelerate the testing and evaluation of \\nthe most promising AI technologies which meet the strategic aims set out\\n in the\\u00a0NHS Long Term Plan.

The\\n Award will support technologies across the spectrum of development: \\nfrom initial feasibility to evaluation within the NHS. Initially, it \\nwill focus on four key areas: screening, diagnosis, decision support and\\n improving system efficiency.

A call for applications for the AI \\nAward will run at least twice a year through an open competition to \\nidentify appropriate AI technologies for support into the NHS. The \\napplication process for the first competition is open from 28 January \\n2020 and closes at 1pm on 4 March 2020. To find out more, visit\\u00a0the AAC website. For further information and enquiries, please contact\\u00a0enquiries@ai-award.info.

Guidance and tools for commissioners and developers

If you are developing adata-driven technology or want to commission a system utilising it, you may find the following helpful:

  • Future Advocacy - Artificial Intelligence: maximising opportunities, minimising risks

    https://futureadvocacy.com/ai-think-tank/

  • Reform - Data-drivenhealthcare: regulation & regulators
  • An\\n overview of the user needs from Automated Decision systems: (The Royal \\nSociety for the encouragement of Arts, Manufactures and Commerce's \\nreport on user needs.
  • In development: A self-assurance \\nportal (due end 2019 in beta) helping developers work through the \\nprinciples within the Code of Conduct, in a practical and step by step \\nway.
\", \"id\":\"770e3bed-694a-41fb-aa94-b5e98bec685a\"}]"}

{"pk": 18, "path": "00010001000B", "depth": 3, "numchild": 1, "title": "Key tools and info", "draft_title": "Key tools and info", "slug": "key-tools-and-info", "content_type": 34, "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": false, "url_path": "/home/key-tools-and-info/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "locked_at": null, "locked_by": null, "first_published_at": "2020-04-08T04:11:49.051Z", "last_published_at": "2020-04-08T04:11:49.051Z", "latest_revision_created_at": "2020-04-08T04:11:49.001Z", "live_revision": 35, "page_links": "[]", "automatic": false, "fb_og_image": null, "fb_og_title": null, "fb_og_description": null, "twitter_card_image": null, "twitter_card_title": null, "twitter_card_alt_text": null, "twitter_card_description": null, "headline": null, "sub_head": null, "image": null,"body": "[{\"type\": \"rich_text\", \"value\": \"

Standards, guidance and support for digital teams.

NHSX will define strategy and set standards, for example, on:

  • user experience

  • open source

This part of the website hosts NHSX-owned content and signposts to a range of information and tools on other organisations\\u2019 websites so that it\\u2019s easy to find all the information you need in one place.

{"pk": 28, "path": "00010001000E", "depth": 3, "numchild": 0, "title": "Accessibility statement", "draft_title": "Accessibility statement", "slug": "accessibility-statement", "content_type": 33, "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": false, "url_path": "/home/accessibility-statement/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "locked_at": null, "locked_by": null, "first_published_at": null, "last_published_at": null, "latest_revision_created_at": null, "live_revision": null, "page_links": "[]", "automatic": false, "fb_og_image": null, "fb_og_title": null, "fb_og_description": null, "twitter_card_image": null, "twitter_card_title": null, "twitter_card_alt_text": null, "twitter_card_description": null, "body": "[{\"type\": \"rich_text\", \"value\": \"

We aim to make the NHSX website as accessible and easy to use as possible. We've designed our pages to meet the\\u00a0Web Content Accessibility Guidelines\\u00a0to level AA and we've tested them with users with access needs. Some external site links may not be to WCAG level AA. Should you require that information in a different format please email us at\\u00a0feedback@nhsx.nhs.uk

How to contact us

If you have any questions about accessibility, please email us at\\u00a0feedback@nhsx.nhs.uk. We will respond within 5 working days.

\", \"id\": \"02aff5b6-f19b-4e00-9c0e-227621629594\"}]"}

{"pk": 29, "path": "00010001000F", "depth": 3, "numchild": 0, "title": "Cookies", "draft_title": "Cookies", "slug": "cookies", "content_type": 33, "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": false, "url_path": "/home/cookies/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked":false, "locked_at": null, "locked_by": null, "first_published_at": null, "last_published_at": null, "latest_revision_created_at": null, "live_revision": null, "page_links": "[]", "automatic": false, "fb_og_image": null, "fb_og_title": null, "fb_og_description": null, "twitter_card_image": null, "twitter_card_title": null, "twitter_card_alt_text": null, "twitter_card_description": null, "body": "[{\"type\": \"rich_text\", \"value\": \"

What are cookies?

Cookies are files saved on your phone, tablet or computer when you visita website.

They store information about how you use the website, such as the pages you visit.

Cookies are not viruses or computer programs. They are very small so do not take up much space.

How we use cookies

We use cookies to:

  • make our website work, for example by keeping it secure and fast
  • measure how you use our website, such as which pages you visit (anonymously)

\", \"id\": \"b4e71cec-780f-489f-9f0c-9a1e63093e1d\"}, {\"type\": \"expander\", \"value\": {\"title\": \"List of cookies that make our website work\", \"body\": [{\"type\": \"richtext\", \"value\": \"Cookie names and purposesCookie namePurposeExpiryARRAffinityHelps our website work faster.When you close the browsernhsuk-cookie-consentRemembers if you used our cookies bannerWhen you close the browser (if you do not use the banner) or 1 year (if you use the banner)\", \"id\": \"b4fc0b49-56f2-4fb9-a9c5-4fc0dfcb4223\"}]}, \"id\": \"0c56bea0-c1fb-41b8-ab52-cd499c5dde14\"}, {\"type\": \"rich_text\", \"value\": \"

Change your cookie settings

Some cookies, like those used to measure how you use our website, are not needed for our website to work.

These cookies can help us make our website better, but we'll only use them if you say it's OK.

\", \"id\": \"a19999bc-3d58-4a08-9b3f-12e9ccdff8c7\"}, {\"type\": \"rich_text\",\"value\": \"

How we use the information we collect

To find out how we collect, store and use information about you or your visit, see\\u00a0our privacy policy.

\", \"id\": \"133eb1cb-c31c-4c17-8478-f64b61577566\"}]"}

{"pk": 30, "path": "00010001000G", "depth": 3, "numchild": 0, "title": "Privacy policy", "draft_title": "Privacy policy", "slug": "privacy-policy", "content_type": 33, "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": false, "url_path": "/home/privacy-policy/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "locked_at": null, "locked_by": null, "first_published_at": null, "last_published_at": null, "latest_revision_created_at": null, "live_revision": null, "page_links": "[]", "automatic": false, "fb_og_image": null, "fb_og_title": null, "fb_og_description": null, "twitter_card_image": null, "twitter_card_title": null, "twitter_card_alt_text": null, "twitter_card_description": null, "body": "[{\"type\": \"rich_text\", \"value\": \"

{"pk": 32, "path": "00010001000I", "depth": 3, "numchild": 0, "title": "Terms and conditions", "draft_title": "Terms and conditions", "slug": "terms-and-conditions", "content_type": 33, "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": false, "url_path": "/home/terms-and-conditions/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "locked_at": null, "locked_by": null, "first_published_at": null, "last_published_at": null, "latest_revision_created_at": null, "live_revision": null, "page_links": "[]", "automatic": false, "fb_og_image": null, "fb_og_title": null, "fb_og_description": null, "twitter_card_image": null, "twitter_card_title": null, "twitter_card_alt_text": null, "twitter_card_description": null, "body": "[{\"type\": \"rich_text\", \"value\": \"

Summary

Use of this website is governed by these terms and conditions.

1. About these terms

1.1\\u00a0\\u00a0 \\u00a0Please read these terms and conditions carefully before you start to use this website (www.nhsx.nhs.uk\\u00a0and all sections and pages). This website is hosted by NHS England and any references to NHSX means NHS England as host. You may access and use this website if you agree to be legally bound by these terms and conditions set out here.

If you do not agree to be legally bound by these terms and conditions, please do not access and/or use this website. We recommend that you print a copy of these terms and conditions for future reference.

1.3\\u00a0\\u00a0 \\u00a0References in these terms and conditions to "NHSX", "we", "our" and "us" means the non-departmental public body responsible for driving digital transformation and leading policy, implementation and change for the NHS by working with partner organisations and teams from the Department of Health and Social Care, NHS England and NHS Improvement. The entire content of this website, and the individual articles, items, media files and assets published are owned by NHSX, unless otherwise indicated.

1.4\\u00a0\\u00a0 \\u00a0This website is intended for use only by people who live in the United Kingdom. References to "the NHS" mean "the NHS in England", unless otherwise stated. Services and arrangements may differ elsewhere in the UK.

1.5\\u00a0\\u00a0 \\u00a0If you have any queries in respect of youruse of this website, please contact us at:\\u00a0feedback@nhsx.nhs.uk.

1.6\\u00a0\\u00a0 \\u00a0We may make changes to these terms and conditions, the terms and conditions applicable to any specific sub-site, the\\u00a0privacy\\u00a0and\\u00a0cookies policy\\u00a0and any other policies applicable to your use of this website, at any time. Your continuing use of this website constitutes your acceptance of and agreement to any such changed terms and conditions and policies.

1.7\\u00a0\\u00a0 \\u00a0Every time you wish to use our site, please check these terms to make sure you understand the terms that apply at the time.

1.8\\u00a0\\u00a0 \\u00a0We may update and change our site from time to time to reflect changes to our users\\u2019 needs and developing priorities for technology, digital and data improvement across the NHS.

1.9\\u00a0\\u00a0 \\u00a0To the extent that we are practically able to doso, we may terminate your access to any part of this website at any time without notice if you breach any of these terms and conditions.

2. Accessibility and browsers

2.1\\u00a0\\u00a0 \\u00a0NHSX aims to make this website and the material provided accessible to as many people as possible. This website is designed to work with the latest versions of Microsoft Edge, Google Chrome and Apple Safari, and uses standards which should work on the majority of browsers in use. \\u00a0We offer no warranty for this website working in any particular browser or configuration.Please note that you may see inconsistencies in the presentation of pages if you are using an older or deprecated version of a browser. Read further information on the\\u00a0accessibility of this website.

3.Information about you and your visits to this website

3.1\\u00a0\\u00a0 \\u00a0NHSX processes information about you in accordance withour\\u00a0privacy policy\\u00a0and\\u00a0cookies policy. By using this website, you consent to such processing and you warrant that all data provided by you is accurate.

4. Freedom of Information

4.1\\u00a0\\u00a0 \\u00a0The data rights and responsibilitiesof NHSX, its staff and of patients is governed by the Freedom of Information Act 2000 and the EU General Data Protection Regulation. For policy andother information, see\\u00a0Freedom of Information\\u00a0(NHS England website).

5. Prohibited uses of this website

5.1\\u00a0\\u00a0 \\u00a0You may use this website only for lawful purposes. You may not use this website:

  • in any way that breaches any applicable local, national or international law or regulation
  • in any way that is unlawful, fraudulent or harmful to other users, or has any unlawful, fraudulent or harmful purpose or effect
  • to send, knowingly receive, upload, download, use or re-use any material which does not comply with these terms and conditions
  • to transmit, or produce the sending of, any unsolicited or unauthorised advertising or promotional material or any other form of similar solicitation (spam) and
  • to knowingly transmit any data, send or upload any material that contains viruses, Trojan horses, worms, spyware or any other harmful programs or similar computer code designed to adversely affect the operation of any computer software or hardware.

5.2\\u00a0\\u00a0 \\u00a0You also agree not to access without authority, interfere with, damage or disrupt:

  • any part of this website
  • any equipment or network on which thiswebsite is stored
  • any software used in the provision of this website or
  • any equipment or network or software owned or used by any third-party.

6. Material on this website

6.1\\u00a0\\u00a0 \\u00a0The material on this website includes information, data, text, images, videos,\\u00a0 interactive services, link to products and apps and other works (\\u201cNHSX Content\\u201d). \\u00a0You acknowledge that all rights in copyright, patents, design rights, trade marks and other intellectual property rights (whether registered, capable of registration or otherwise) throughout the world, in this website and all NHSX Content are owned by, or licensed to NHSX, unless otherwise indicated. SomeNHSX Content includes identifiable third-party content for which we will have sought permission for its inclusion.

6.2\\u00a0\\u00a0 \\u00a0Except for your use of this website in accordance with these terms and conditions, you are granted no rights in respect of this website or any NHSX Content.

7. Your use of NHSX Content

7.1\\u00a0\\u00a0\\u00a0Copyright and database rights in the NHSX Content are releasedfree-of-charge under the current version of the Open Government Licence ("OGL"), except where specified, either in these terms and conditions, elsewhere on this website or in the OGL terms. \\u00a0This licence does not extend to any other intellectual property rights, including but not limited to patents, design rights and trade marks. If there is any conflict between the OGL terms and these terms and conditions, these terms and conditions shall take precedence.

7.2\\u00a0\\u00a0 \\u00a0This means that you can use NHSX Content, including copying it, adapting it, and using it for any purpose, including commercially, provided you follow these terms and conditions and the terms of the OGL.

7.3\\u00a0\\u00a0 \\u00a0The OGL terms do not apply to the following categories of NHSX Content, and therefore these must not be used without our or the relevant owner\\u2019s prior consent:

  • any logos, visuals, image rights, trademarks, trade names and design styles (except where these areintegral to a document or data set) of NHSX, or any predecessor or linked body, as well as of any partner or contributor
  • software, source code and any technical documentation relating to software or source code except where released on\\u00a0https://developer.nhs.uk, a public repository on GitHub, or any other platform we may specify from time-to-time
  • information ownedby third parties which we are not authorised to licence on to you. This information will be clearly marked. If in doubt, contact us using the details above
  • information gained through any services or sections on this website (or linked websites) which can only be accessed by logged-in users, and
  • any information which is marked as being under a different licence, or not for release.

7.4\\u00a0\\u00a0 \\u00a0If you do use any NHSX Content you must attribute it with the following statement:

\\u201cInformation from NHSX, licenced under the current version of the Open Government Licence\\u201d

or in cases where the NHSX Content is combined, adapted, or otherwise modified in line with these terms and conditions:

\\u201cContains information from NHSX, licenced under the current version of the Open Government Licence\\u201d.

7.5\\u00a0\\u00a0 \\u00a0By using any NHSX Content you accept and agree to the following terms:

  • you must not alter, adapt, edit or modify any NHSX branding where this is integral to a document or data set
  • if you do alter, adapt, edit or modify any NHSX Content in accordance with these terms and conditions, where possible, you should remove the NHSX branding
  • you may not directly or indirectly suggest any endorsement or approval by NHSX of your site or any non-NHSX entity, product or content or any views expressed within your site or service
  • NHSX has absolute editorial control over all NHSX Content and reserves the right to alter, adapt, edit, modify or restrict the availability of NHSX Content without prior notice, and
  • you should refresh cached content every 24 hours to make sure you have the most up-to-date version.

8. Uploading material to this website

8.1\\u00a0\\u00a0 \\u00a0Whenever you make use of a feature that allows you to upload material to this website, for example when you participate in online discussions, contact other users of this website or submit any apps or products, you must comply with the standards set out in the comments and moderation policy. You warrant that any such contribution does comply with those standards, and you indemnify us for any breach of that warranty. You acknowledge that such uploaded material has not been verified or approved by us.

8.2\\u00a0\\u00a0 \\u00a0Any material you upload to this website will be considered non-confidential and non-proprietary, and NHSX has theright to use, copy, distribute and disclose to third-parties any such material for any purpose. Furthermore NHSX also has the right to disclose your identity to any third-party who is claiming that any material posted or uploaded by you to this website constitutes a violation of their intellectual property rights, or their right to privacy.

8.3\\u00a0\\u00a0 \\u00a0NHSX will not be responsible, or liable to any third-party, forthe content or accuracy of any materials posted by you or any other user of this website.

8.4\\u00a0\\u00a0 \\u00a0NHSX has the right to remove any material or posting you make on this website if, in our opinion, such material does not comply with the standards set out in these terms and conditions and the comments and moderation policy.

8.5\\u00a0\\u00a0 \\u00a0Comments posted should relate to your personal experience or that of someone close to you. You should not name any individuals (other than yourself) or include information through which someone else could identify an individual about whom you are writing. If you want to comment on someone else\\u2019s experience, (e.g. a relative or someone you care for), then you may do so if you make sure that you are not named in the posting and you state how the other person is connected to you (e.g. \\u201cmy father\\u201d). You warrant that all statements of fact in any comment you submit are true, and that any expression of opinion is your honestly held opinion on those facts, or that of the person on whose behalf you are writing.

8.6\\u00a0\\u00a0 \\u00a0If you find any comments offensive or objectionable, you may make a complaint to the moderator using the \\u2018Report\\u2019 link provided at the foot of each published comment.

8.7\\u00a0\\u00a0 \\u00a0We have many measures in place to keep your information safe. But it is important that you also play your part \\u2013 visit the Government's Get Safe Online website for advice on how to do this.

9. Social media, bookmarking, and digital engagement

9.1\\u00a0\\u00a0 \\u00a0NHSX may from time to time provide third party or owned social media and interactive services on this website or linked to this website. Currently this includes and is not limited to:

  • YouTube \\u2013 for sharing video content
  • Twitter \\u2013 for sharing news and participating in conversations with users
  • blogs \\u2013 \\u00a0to share the opinions of NHSX\\u2019s staff and other key figures
  • discussion forums \\u2013 for participation in conversations with users
  • RSS feeds \\u2013 for sharing news
  • social bookmarking \\u2013 to allow users to share our content more easily on popular social media platforms.

9.2\\u00a0\\u00a0 \\u00a0NHSX is under no obligation to oversee, monitor or moderate any interactive services we provide from this website, and we expressly exclude our liability for any loss or damage arising from the use of these interactive services by a user in contravention of these terms and conditions, whether the service is moderated or not.

9.3\\u00a0\\u00a0 \\u00a0Our RSS feeds can be used as part of your website; however, we do require that proper format and attribution are used. The attribution text should read \\u201cNHSX RSS feeds\\u201d. We reserve the right from time to time to restrict the distribution of NHSX RSS feed content and do not accept any liability for these feeds.

9.4\\u00a0\\u00a0 \\u00a0Use of our social bookmarking links is subject to these terms and conditions. See \\u2018Linking from this website\\u2019 below.

9.5\\u00a0\\u00a0 \\u00a0Although we do monitor and review discussions, chat, postings, transmissions, bulletin boards and thelike on this website and its subsections, we are under no obligation to do so and assume no responsibility or liability arising from the content ofany such locations nor for any error, omission, infringement, defamation, obscenity, or inaccuracy contained in any information within such locations on this website.

9.6\\u00a0\\u00a0 \\u00a0The use of any of the interactive features on this website by a minor is subject to the consent of their parent or guardian, and we advise parents to communicate with their children about their safety online, as moderation is not foolproof. Minors who are using any interactive service should be made aware of the potential risks to them. Where we do moderate any of the interactive features on this website, we will normally provide you with a means of contacting the moderator, should a concern or difficulty arise.

10. Linking to this website

10.1\\u00a0\\u00a0 \\u00a0We do not object to you linking directly to pages on this website, provided you do so in a way that is fair and legal and does not damage our reputation or take advantage of it. We reserve the right to move or change this website\\u2019sURLs at any time. Rather than deep linking, we recommend linking to section homepages, which are less likely to move or change.

10.2\\u00a0\\u00a0 \\u00a0However, we don\\u2019t give permission to suggest that your website is associated, or endorsed by us.

10.3\\u00a0\\u00a0 \\u00a0We reserve the right to withdraw linking permission without notice.

11. Linking from this website

11.1\\u00a0\\u00a0\\u00a0We are not responsible for the content or reliability of the websites we link to and do not necessarily endorse the views expressed withinthem. We aim to replace broken links to other sites but cannot guarantee that these links will always work as we have no control over the availability of other sites.

11.2\\u00a0\\u00a0 \\u00a0Due to the very nature of the internet we cannot guarantee this website or other websites we link to will always be available to you.

12. Disclaimer and liabilities

12.1\\u00a0\\u00a0 \\u00a0This website, all NHSX Content and all material relating to Government information, products and services (or to third-party information, products and services) is provided "as is", without any endorsement and without warranty of any kind whether express or implied, including but not limited to the implied warranties of satisfactory quality, fitness for a particular purpose, non-infringement, compatibility, security and accuracy. \\u00a0This means that, while we do try to make sure that all our information is correct, we are not liable for any errors or omissions, and cannot be responsible for any impact these have on you.

12.2\\u00a0\\u00a0 \\u00a0If the need arises, we reserve the right to amend, delete, suspend or withdraw all or any part of this website without notice. NHSX will not be liable if for any reason this website or any parts are unavailable at any time.

12.3\\u00a0\\u00a0 \\u00a0We do not warrant that the functions of this website will be uninterrupted or error free, that defects will be corrected, or that this website or the server that makes it available will be free of viruses or represent the full functionality, accuracy or reliability ofthe materials. You should use your own virus protection software.

12.4\\u00a0\\u00a0 \\u00a0NHSX and any approving bodies are not the owners, managers or suppliers of various products which can be accessed from this website. NHSX or the approving body sets standards for reviewing the products, but this does not mean that NHSX or the approving body has itself reviewed all aspects of each product, or version of the same product. NHSX or the approving body is not responsible or liable for any advice, or any other information, services or products that you obtain using any such products.

12.5\\u00a0\\u00a0 \\u00a0Material on this website is provided for information and educational purposes only and we do not guarantee that information we provide will meet your health or medical requirements. NHSX does not give medical advice in relation to any individual case or patient, nor does NHSX provide medical or diagnostic services.

  • For less urgent health needs, contact your GP or local pharmacist in the usual way.
  • If you have an urgent medical need, you should call 111.
  • If a life is at risk, call 999.

12.6\\u00a0\\u00a0 \\u00a0In no event will we be liable for any loss or damage including, without limitation, indirect or consequential loss or damage, or any loss or damages whatsoever arising from use or loss of use of, data or profits arising out of or in connection with the use of this website. Nothing in these terms and conditions will operate to limit or exclude liability for death or personal injury arising from our negligence, nor our liability for fraudulent misrepresentation, nor any other liability which cannot be excluded or limited under applicable law.

13. General

13.1\\u00a0\\u00a0 \\u00a0If any of these terms and conditions are determined to be illegal, invalid or otherwise unenforceable, then the remaining terms and conditions shall remain in full force and effect.

13.2\\u00a0\\u00a0 \\u00a0The laws of England shall apply exclusively to these terms and conditions and to all matters relating to use of this website. Any cause of action arising under these terms and conditions or the use of this website shall be subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of England and Wales.

{"pk": 34, "path": "0001000100070001", "depth": 4, "numchild": 0, "title": "Information Governance", "draft_title": "Information Governance", "slug": "information-governance", "content_type": 33, "live": false, "has_unpublished_changes": false, "url_path": "/home/covid-19-response/information-governance/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "locked_at": null, "locked_by": null, "first_published_at": null, "last_published_at": null, "latest_revision_created_at": null, "live_revision": null, "page_links": "[]", "automatic": false, "fb_og_image": null, "fb_og_title": null, "fb_og_description": null, "twitter_card_image": null, "twitter_card_title": null, "twitter_card_alt_text": null, "twitter_card_description": null, "body": "[]"}

{"pk": 34, "path": "0001000100070001", "depth": 4, "numchild": 0, "title": "Information Governance", "draft_title": "Information Governance", "slug": "information-governance", "content_type": 33, "live": false, "has_unpublished_changes": true, "url_path": "/home/covid-19-response/information-governance/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "locked_at": null, "locked_by": null, "first_published_at": null, "last_published_at": null, "latest_revision_created_at": "2020-04-09T07:05:27.893Z", "live_revision": null, "page_links": "[]", "automatic": false, "fb_og_image": null, "fb_og_title": null, "fb_og_description": null, "twitter_card_image": null, "twitter_card_title": null, "twitter_card_alt_text": null, "twitter_card_description": null, "body": "[{\"type\": \"rich_text\", \"value\": \"

Information governance is all about how to manage and share information appropriately.

Covid-19 Information Governance Advice

  • Advice for health and care professionals
  • Advice for the social care sector
  • Advice for IG professionals

Covid-19 Example Privacy Notice

NHSX continues to work closely with the National Data Guardian (NDG) and Information Commissioner's Office (ICO) to ensure a high level of transparency for patients during this period. This\\u00a0example supplementary privacy notice\\u00a0can be used by organisations to inform patients about the ways information is being used as a result of Covid-19.

How datais supporting the Covid-19 response

You can read current examples of how data is being used to support the Covid-19 response\\u00a0here.

The use of mobile devices by patients in hospitals

This guidance\\u00a0provides advice for patients using mobile devices such as phones, tabletsand cameras in acute hospitals. This is particularly important at this time when patients may be isolated from loved ones.

COPI Notice - frequently asked questions

The Secretary of State for Health and Care has issued a range of Notices which require that data is shared for purposes of Covid-19. Read more about COPI Notices and what they mean\\u00a0here.

NHSX is building up information governance resources and information which we will make available here as soon as they are ready. In the meantime, if your Data Protection Officer or Caldicott Guardian is unsure of appropriate action to take, you can direct Information Governance questions to the\\u00a0NHSX IG team.

\", \"id\": \"8166060c-52ed-48e8-a159-e5f2afbca929\"}]"}

{"pk": 35, "path": "0001000100070002", "depth": 4, "numchild": 0, "title": "Tech plan for health and care", "draft_title": "Tech plan for health and care", "slug": "tech-plan-health-and-care", "content_type": 33, "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": false, "url_path": "/home/covid-19-response/tech-plan-health-and-care/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "locked_at": null, "locked_by": null, "first_published_at": null, "last_published_at": null, "latest_revision_created_at": null, "live_revision": null, "page_links": "[]", "automatic": false, "fb_og_image": null, "fb_og_title": null, "fb_og_description": null, "twitter_card_image": null, "twitter_card_title": null, "twitter_card_alt_text": null, "twitter_card_description": null, "body": "[{\"type\": \"rich_text\", \"value\": \"

NHSX is a joint unit bringing together teams from the Department of Health and Social Care and NHS England and NHS Improvement to drive the digitaltransformation of care.

Tech plan for health and care

NHSX will be engaging on a tech plan for health and care throughout Spring and Summer 2020.

Whether you\\u2019re an NHS CEO, a care professional, an administrator, a patient, a health charity worker or a developer; we want everyone to have their say on how technology is used to transform health and social care.

We\\u2019ll work openly with you to make sure all the essential building blocks, a clear division of labour and a plan are in place for tech-enabled care.

Over the next few months we\\u2019ll publish information iteratively and in phases as we develop the plan. We\\u2019re asking for your views to help shape each section as we go.

Join in the conversation\\u00a0or email\\u00a0techplan@nhsx.nhs.uk.

Policy and programme information

Information about pre-existing policy and programmes remains on\\u00a0NHS England's Digital transformation website\\u00a0and\\u00a0Gov.uk.

\", \"id\": \"1bea87d3-5ea0-4056-8752-0047010ec0aa\"}]"}

{"pk": 36, "path": "0001000100070003", "depth": 4, "numchild": 0, "title": "Apps and tools for patient care", "draft_title": "Apps and tools for patient care", "slug": "apps-and-tools-patient-care", "content_type": 33, "live": false, "has_unpublished_changes": false, "url_path": "/home/covid-19-response/apps-and-tools-patient-care/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "locked_at": null, "locked_by": null, "first_published_at": null, "last_published_at": null, "latest_revision_created_at": null, "live_revision": null, "page_links": "[]", "automatic": false, "fb_og_image": null, "fb_og_title": null, "fb_og_description": null, "twitter_card_image": null, "twitter_card_title": null, "twitter_card_alt_text": null, "twitter_card_description": null, "body": "[{\"type\": \"rich_text\", \"value\": \"

Apps and tools for patient care

New digital apps and tools are empowering people to take control of their health and improving patient care.

Our roadmap

The\\u00a0Empower the Person roadmap\\u00a0sets out what's available now, along with delivery milestones for meeting our aim of giving people and patients the digital tools and information they need to better manage their health, wellbeing and care. (Links to an external website. Please see\\u00a0Accessibility Statement)

Where we are working

You can see where we are working on Empower the Person programmes, plotted on our\\u00a0interactive (beta) map.

Join our community

Join our\\u00a0Empower the Person community of interest\\u00a0to access presentations, latest updates and discussion forums. Log in using your nhs.net email. If you don\\u2019t have one, email\\u00a0england.digitalhealth@nhs.net\\u00a0for access.

Our digital services for patients at a glance

The NHS website

The NHS website (nhs.uk) gives the public information about conditions, treatments, medicines, NHS services and more.

NHS App

The\\u00a0NHS App\\u00a0is a simple and secure way for people to access a range of NHS services on their smartphone or tablet.

NHS login

The\\u00a0NHS login\\u00a0makes it easier and quicker for people to see their personal health information online. In future, they\\u2019ll use it to access other health and social care services online.

NHS Apps Library

The\\u00a0apps library\\u00a0on nhs.uk helps patients and the public find tools to help them manage and improve their health.

GP IT Futures

A new\\u00a0GP IT Futures framework

https://digital.nhs.uk/services/future-gp-it-systems-and-services

\\u00a0will replace the contractual\\u00a0GP System of Choice\\u00a0framework, to supply IT systems and services to GP Practices in England.

Digital first and online consultations programme

Supporting the move towards a\\u00a0digital first\\u00a0approach, where patients can easily access the advice, support and treatment they need using digital and online tools, including\\u00a0online consultations.

NHS wifi

NHS WiFi\\u00a0is working to make sure everyone can access free, secure and consistent WiFi services at NHS sites across England.

Examples of how technology can improve patient care

\", \"id\": \"033ccb28-1d50-4f7d-afbc-22354dcb0b28\"}, {\"type\": \"embed\", \"value\": \"https://youtu.be/Qv_NChcS29Q\", \"id\": \"5d6f30e5-a65d-4eab-bd66-5b900c5ce72c\"}]"}

{"pk": 37, "path": "0001000100070004", "depth": 4, "numchild": 0, "title": "Designing and building products and services", "draft_title": "Designing and building products and services", "slug": "designing-and-building-products-and-services", "content_type": 33, "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": false, "url_path": "/home/covid-19-response/designing-and-building-products-and-services/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "locked_at": null, "locked_by": null, "first_published_at": null, "last_published_at": null, "latest_revision_created_at": null, "live_revision": null, "page_links": "[]", "automatic": false, "fb_og_image": null, "fb_og_title": null, "fb_og_description": null, "twitter_card_image": null, "twitter_card_title": null, "twitter_card_alt_text": null, "twitter_card_description": null, "body": "[{\"type\": \"rich_text\", \"value\": \"

Resources for people developing services and technologies in health and social care.

NHS Digital Health Technology Standard consultation

To improve the way the NHS assesses technologies for use by patients and staff, NHSX is developing a Digital Health Technology Standard. This aims to help developers understand what\\u2019s expected of them, and speed up and streamline how health technologies are reviewed and commissioned for use in the NHS.\\u00a0Take a look at the draft standard, and then\\u00a0complete our short survey\\u00a0to ensure a robust, proportionate and attainable standard. The consultation runs until Wednesday 22 April 2020.

Data-driven health and care technology

NHSX wants to make the NHS a world leader in developing ethical and safe data-driven technologies.\\u00a0Find out more information on what AI is, why AI matters, what our AI lab will do and the tools and guidance we have developed to support innovators in this field.

Evidence standards framework for digital health technologies

The National Institute for Health and Care Excellence (NICE) has worked with partners to develop a\\u00a0standards framework\\u00a0to make sure new technologies are clinically effective and offer economic value.

NHS developer network

NHS Digital's\\u00a0NHS developer network\\u00a0includes technical information, software tools, source code and data for developers who are designing and building software for use inhealth and social care.

NHS digital service manual

The\\u00a0digital servicemanual\\u00a0helps NHS teams design and build consistent, usable digital services that put people first. It includes:

  • the NHS.UK frontend library
  • prototyping kit
  • design principles
  • UI styles, patterns and components
  • content style guide
  • accessibility and other practice guidance

\", \"id\": \"92f37942-919d-4959-b405-2a676f378467\"}]"}

{"pk": 48, "path": "000100010007000F", "depth": 4, "numchild": 0, "title": "The NHS Coronavirus status checker","draft_title": "The NHS Coronavirus status checker", "slug": "nhs-coronavirus-status-checker", "content_type": 33, "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": false, "url_path": "/home/covid-19-response/nhs-coronavirus-status-checker/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "locked_at": null, "locked_by": null, "first_published_at": "2020-04-09T07:15:19.803Z", "last_published_at": "2020-04-09T07:15:19.803Z", "latest_revision_created_at": "2020-04-09T07:15:19.764Z", "live_revision": 95, "page_links": "[]", "automatic": true, "fb_og_image": null, "fb_og_title": null, "fb_og_description": null, "twitter_card_image": null, "twitter_card_title": null, "twitter_card_alt_text": null, "twitter_card_description": null, "body": "[]"}

{"pk": 48, "path": "000100010007000F", "depth": 4, "numchild": 0, "title": "The NHS Coronavirus status checker","draft_title": "The NHS Coronavirus status checker", "slug": "nhs-coronavirus-status-checker", "content_type": 33, "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": false, "url_path": "/home/covid-19-response/nhs-coronavirus-status-checker/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "locked_at": null, "locked_by": null, "first_published_at": "2020-04-09T07:15:19.803Z", "last_published_at": "2020-04-09T07:52:50.877Z", "latest_revision_created_at": "2020-04-09T07:52:50.803Z", "live_revision": 101, "page_links": "[]", "automatic": true, "fb_og_image": null, "fb_og_title": null, "fb_og_description": null, "twitter_card_image": null, "twitter_card_title": null, "twitter_card_alt_text": null, "twitter_card_description": null, "body": "[{\"type\": \"rich_text\", \"value\": \"The NHS asks people to share their coronavirus symptoms to help others

\\u00a0

A new Coronavirus Status Checker which will help the NHS coordinate its response and build up additional data on the COVID-19 outbreak was launched 4 April 2020 by Health and Social Care Secretary Matt Hancock.

People with potential coronavirus symptoms are being asked to complete the status checker and answer a short series of questions which will tell the NHS about their experience.

It is open to anyone in the UK to use on the NHS website and in its initial phase the NHSis particularly keen for anyone who thinks they may be displaying potential coronavirus symptoms, no matter how mild, to complete it.

Status Checker users are clearly told at the beginning and the end of the survey that it is not a triage or clinical advice tool, and that they should visit 111 online for medical advice about their symptoms.

The information gathered will help the NHS to plan its response to the outbreak, indicating when and where more resources like oxygen, ventilators and additional staff might be needed and will provide valuable insight into the development and progression of the virus across the country.

More details about the service can be accessed at\\u00a0https://www.gov.uk/government/news/nhs-asks-people-to-share-their-coronavirus-symptoms-to-help-others

https://www.gov.uk/government/news/nhs-asks-people-to-share-their-coronavirus-symptoms-to-help-others


\", \"id\": \"e5178f84-ccb5-44d5-8126-e6353bb513fb\"}]"}

{"pk": 48, "path": "000100010007000F", "depth": 4, "numchild": 0, "title": "The NHS Coronavirus status checker","draft_title": "The NHS Coronavirus status checker", "slug": "nhs-coronavirus-status-checker", "content_type": 33, "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": false, "url_path": "/home/covid-19-response/nhs-coronavirus-status-checker/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "locked_at": null, "locked_by": null, "first_published_at": "2020-04-09T07:15:19.803Z", "last_published_at": "2020-04-09T07:54:45.896Z", "latest_revision_created_at": "2020-04-09T07:54:45.822Z", "live_revision": 102, "page_links": "[]", "automatic": true, "fb_og_image": null, "fb_og_title": null, "fb_og_description": null, "twitter_card_image": null, "twitter_card_title": null, "twitter_card_alt_text": null, "twitter_card_description": null, "body": "[{\"type\": \"rich_text\", \"value\": \"

The NHS asks people to share their coronavirus symptoms to help others

A new Coronavirus Status Checker which will help theNHS coordinate its response and build up additional data on the COVID-19 outbreak was launched 4 April 2020 by Health and Social Care Secretary Matt Hancock.

People with potential coronavirus symptoms are being asked to complete the status checker and answer a short series of questions which will tell the NHS about their experience.

It is open to anyone in the UK to use on the NHS website and in its initial phase the NHS is particularly keen for anyone who thinks they may be displaying potential coronavirus symptoms, no matter how mild, to complete it.

Status Checkerusers are clearly told at the beginning and the end of the survey that it is not a triage or clinical advice tool, and that they should visit 111 online for medical advice about their symptoms.

The information gathered will help the NHS to plan its response to the outbreak, indicating when and where more resources like oxygen, ventilators and additional staff might be needed and will provide valuable insight into the development and progression of the virus across the country.

More details about the service can be accessed at\\u00a0https://www.gov.uk/government/news/nhs-asks-people-to-share-their-coronavirus-symptoms-to-help-others

https://www.gov.uk/government/news/nhs-asks-people-to-share-their-coronavirus-symptoms-to-help-others


\", \"id\": \"e5178f84-ccb5-44d5-8126-e6353bb513fb\"}]"}

{"pk": 8, "path": "0001000100040001", "depth": 4, "numchild": 0, "title": "Who we are", "draft_title": "Who we are", "slug": "who-we-are", "content_type": 33, "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": false, "url_path": "/home/about-us/who-we-are/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "locked_at": null, "locked_by": null, "first_published_at": "2020-04-07T13:13:16.680Z", "last_published_at": "2020-04-07T13:13:16.680Z", "latest_revision_created_at": "2020-04-07T13:13:16.621Z", "live_revision": 27, "page_links": "[]", "automatic": false, "fb_og_image": null, "fb_og_title": null, "fb_og_description": null, "twitter_card_image": null, "twitter_card_title": null, "twitter_card_alt_text": null, "twitter_card_description": null, "body": "[{\"type\": \"rich_text\", \"value\": \"

NHSX brings teams from the Department of Health and Social Care, NHS England and NHS Improvement together into one unit to drive digital transformation andlead policy, implementation and change.

We are a diverse team with a range of skills and expertise, including clinicians, technologists, policy experts, developers, data scientists and project managers.

We report directly to the Secretary of State and the Chief Executive of NHS England and NHS Improvement. We are funded through existing budgets.

Leadership team

The leadership team of NHSX are: Matthew Gould (CEO),Simon Eccles, Tara Donnelly, Hadley Beeman, Kathy Hall, Iain O'Neil and Tim Donohoe.

Teams that have joined NHSX

Programme teamsthat have joined NHSX from NHS England and the Department of Health and Social Care include:

  • artificial intelligence
  • cyber security
  • data transformation and policy
  • digital and technology strategy and oversight
  • digital urgent and emergency care, including NHS 111 online
  • digitising pharmacy
  • digitising providers - including global digital exemplars, our most digitally advanced trusts
  • elective care - including e-referrals
  • empowering the person - our citizen-facing digital portfolio, including the NHS App
  • integrating care locally
  • local health and care records
  • primary care digital transformation - including GP systems, data and digital services
  • social care
  • technical architecture

Find out more about the work of many of these teams on the\\u00a0NHS England digital transformation website.

\", \"id\": \"af72d29d-f5c9-4c3f-8b36-5fe219ad9f03\"}]"}

{"pk": 8, "path": "0001000100040001", "depth": 4, "numchild": 0, "title": "Who we are", "draft_title": "Who we are", "slug": "who-we-are", "content_type": 33, "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": false, "url_path": "/home/about-us/who-we-are/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "locked_at": null, "locked_by": null, "first_published_at": "2020-04-07T13:13:16.680Z", "last_published_at": "2020-04-09T11:12:32.947Z", "latest_revision_created_at": "2020-04-09T11:12:32.895Z", "live_revision": 113, "page_links": "[]", "automatic": true, "fb_og_image": null, "fb_og_title": null, "fb_og_description": null, "twitter_card_image": null, "twitter_card_title": null, "twitter_card_alt_text": null, "twitter_card_description": null, "body": "[{\"type\": \"rich_text\", \"value\": \"

NHSX brings teams from the Department of Health and Social Care, NHS England and NHS Improvement together into one unit to drive digital transformation andlead policy, implementation and change.

We are a diverse team with a range of skills and expertise, including clinicians, technologists, policy experts, developers, data scientists and project managers.

We report directly to the Secretary of State and the Chief Executive of NHS England and NHS Improvement. We are funded through existing budgets.

Leadership team

The leadership team of NHSX are: Matthew Gould (CEO),Simon Eccles, Tara Donnelly, Hadley Beeman, Kathy Hall, Iain O'Neil and Tim Donohoe.

Teams that have joined NHSX

Programme teamsthat have joined NHSX from NHS England and the Department of Health and Social Care include:

  • artificial intelligence
  • cyber security
  • data transformation and policy
  • digital and technology strategy and oversight
  • digital urgent and emergency care, including NHS 111 online
  • digitising pharmacy
  • digitising providers - including global digital exemplars, our most digitally advanced trusts
  • elective care - including e-referrals
  • empowering the person - our citizen-facing digital portfolio, including the NHS App
  • integrating care locally
  • local health and care records
  • primary care digital transformation - including GP systems, data and digital services
  • social care
  • technical architecture

Find out more about the work of many of these teams on the\\u00a0NHS England digital transformation website.

\", \"id\": \"af72d29d-f5c9-4c3f-8b36-5fe219ad9f03\"}]"}

{"pk": 9, "path": "0001000100040002", "depth": 4, "numchild": 0, "title": "What we do", "draft_title": "What we do", "slug": "what-we-do", "content_type": 33, "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": false, "url_path": "/home/about-us/what-we-do/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "locked_at": null, "locked_by": null, "first_published_at": "2020-04-07T13:13:50.517Z", "last_published_at": "2020-04-08T04:35:30.310Z", "latest_revision_created_at": "2020-04-08T04:35:30.245Z", "live_revision": 39, "page_links": "[]", "automatic": true, "fb_og_image": null, "fb_og_title": null, "fb_og_description": null, "twitter_card_image": null, "twitter_card_title": null, "twitter_card_alt_text": null, "twitter_card_description": null, "body": "[{\"type\": \"rich_text\", \"value\": \"

NHSX is leading the largest digital health and social care transformation programme in the world. With investment of more than \\u00a31 billion pounds a year nationally and a significant additional spend locally, NHSX has been created to give staff and citizens the technology they need.

NHSX will deliver the Health Secretary\\u2019s\\u00a0Tech Vision, building on the\\u00a0NHS Long Term Plan. We will speed up the digital transformation of the NHS and social care. We have set ourselves five missions, which are focused on how we can make things better for patients and staff. These are:

  • Reduce the burden on our workforce, so they can focus on delivering care;
  • Give people the tools to access information and services directly, so they can best take charge of their own health and care;
  • Ensure information about people\\u2019s health and care can be safely accessed, wherever it is needed;
  • Aid the improvement of safety across health and care systems; and
  • Improve health and care productivity with digital technology.

Our responsibilities

Coordination and consistency

  • Setting national policy for NHS technology, digital and data (including data-sharing and transparency)
  • Setting the strategy, developing best practice guidance, coordinating activities across the arms-length bodies and national or central programmes
  • Becoming a single point of accountability for national digital transformation programmes and the oversight of NHS Digital

Setting standards

  • Developing, agreeing and mandating clear standards (for example, on user experience, open standards, information governance, and open source) for the use of technology in the NHS
  • Making sure that NHS systems become interoperable and that the NHS can incorporate the latest innovations without breaking the technical plumbing underneath

Driving implementation

  • Helping to improve clinical care by delivering agile, user-focused projects
  • Developing digital care pathways and solving administrative challenges across the NHS
  • Delivering APIs and documentation to empower developers and data analysts across the NHS and the health tech industry
  • Driving digital and tech maturity in local NHS organisations

Radical innovation

  • Supporting the use of new, emergent and effective technologies by the NHS, both by working with industry and through its own prototyping and development

Common technologies and services

  • Making sure that common technologies and services, including the\\u00a0NHS App, are designed so that trusts and surgeries don\\u2019t have to reinvent the wheel each time
  • Making sure that that all source code is open by default so that anyone who wants to write code for the NHS can see what we need

Reforming procurement

  • Helping the NHS buy the right technology through the application of technology standards, streamlined spend controls and new procurement frameworks that support our standards

Cyber policy

  • Setting national strategy and mandating cyber security standards, so that NHS and social care systems have security designed in from the start

Digital capability

  • Championing and developing digital training, skills and culture so our staff are digital-ready

Governance

  • Delivering an efficient process for technology spend, domain name management, and website security
  • Reviewing the effectivenessof governance arrangements regularly
\", \"id\": \"6ca85dea-737b-4695-94fb-58bc77eed1f2\"}]"}

{"pk": 10, "path": "0001000100040003", "depth": 4, "numchild": 0, "title": "How we work", "draft_title": "Howwe work", "slug": "how-we-work", "content_type": 33, "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": false, "url_path": "/home/about-us/how-we-work/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "locked_at": null, "locked_by": null, "first_published_at": "2020-04-07T13:13:39.714Z", "last_published_at": "2020-04-07T13:13:39.714Z", "latest_revision_created_at": "2020-04-07T13:13:39.657Z", "live_revision": 29, "page_links": "[]", "automatic": true, "fb_og_image": null, "fb_og_title": null, "fb_og_description": null, "twitter_card_image": null, "twitter_card_title":null, "twitter_card_alt_text": null, "twitter_card_description": null, "body": "[{\"type\": \"rich_text\", \"value\": \"

Our culture and values.

  • We take time to listen, understand and communicate clearly.
  • We encourage everyone to contribute their skills, knowledge and experience. Everyone\\u2019s voice is equal and respected.
  • We are user-centred and we work openly and with a wide range of partners because that will deliver better outcomes.
  • We value ambition, are open to learning and new ideas, and support people to innovate.
  • We work collaboratively, beyond job roles and across teams.
  • We recognise and celebrate success and take ownership of problems and solutions.

How we work with digital innovators

We want the very best digital solutions for citizens and for NHS and social care staff. We know that technology can help us meet our most pressing strategic challenges \\u2013 improving outcomes, addressing workforce shortages and increasing productivity \\u2013 this is articulated by\\u00a0NHSX\\u2019s five missions.

We also want to support a thriving digital ecosystem, in which both smaller innovators and larger companies can flourish. We believe that this will bring the best solutions and most choice for patients and staff \\u2013 as long as systems are built to the same open standards and are interoperable with each other.

We expect digital innovators who seek to work with the NHS to:

  1. Abide by\\u00a0our guiding principles
  2. Be openand transparent
  3. Leverage best value for the NHS

Abide by our guiding principles

Better use of data between the NHS and partners has the potential to improve diagnosis, treatment, experience of care, efficiency of the system and overall outcomes for the people at the heart of the NHS, public health and the wider healthcare system.

It must be done in a way which is safe, ethical, evidenced and transparent. People need to know that data about them is being used to develop and test healthcare solutions, and that their privacy and rights are safeguarded. For this reason, and to enable partnerships between the NHS and partners to thrive,\\u00a0the government has published five guiding principles.

Digital innovators working with NHSX must abide by these\\u00a0guiding principles,\\u00a0the code of conduct for data-driven health and care technology, the\\u00a0Caldicott Principles\\u00a0and the\\u00a0data ethics framework.

In addition, digital innovators must be in line with all other relevant legislation including the Data Protection Act 2018, Common Law and the Human Rights Act and will need to complete the Data Security and Privacy toolkit. Agreements on data must not be perpetual nor exclusive.

Be open and transparent

We seek to work in the open as far as possible and therefore require those who work with us to:

  • Be open and transparent with the arrangements agreed.
  • Appoint a named lead point person that can fully represent the organisation and take decisions on behalf of it. In the case of smaller companies this is about designating sufficient time of the lead contact, for larger companies this means one person being responsible for coordination across a number of departments to ensure that communications are rapid, efficient and straightforward for theNHS.
  • Develop a 12 month forward look project plan for agreed projects that we will publish.
  • In the case of machine learning or AI technologies we expect algorithms to comply with Principle 7 of the\\u00a0code of conduct for data-driven health and care technology.
  • Rigorously evaluate the impact of technologies and publish this.
  • As part of the development and deployment of new technology, we expect companies to actively demonstrate engagement with patients and the public.

Leverage best value for the NHS

  • Projects need to actively support\\u00a0open standards and interoperability\\u00a0in the NHS and social care. Allowing products to interoperate with each other, with electronic health records, national and other third-party systems is crucial to the value they deliver.
  • Meet relevant health technology standards: building on the work of the NHS Apps Library, NHSX is currently developing an NHS-recognised\\u00a0Digital Health Technology Standard. This will combine elements of the existing\\u00a0Digital Assessment Questions\\u00a0with other data and interoperability standards. It\\u2019s anticipated that all health apps and digital technologies commissioned by or used within the NHS will need to meet this new standard and anyone working with us would be expected to ensure that any relevant products meet the standard.
  • Pricing: we expect best value pricing for the NHS and social care, including zero cost for pre-commercial products, and in the event of opportunities for large scale implementations, substantial discounting to occur.
  • Contracts with NHS or social care collaborators: a number of projects will have formal NHS or social care collaborators and it will be appropriate for contracts to exist between the companies and these NHS Trusts or other type of organisation. In these cases, contracts should reflect all of the expectations set out on this page. We do not expect to hold contracts directly between NHSX and companies.
  • One of NHSX\\u2019s ambitions is to leverage better value from larger technology companies. In line with this we expect contracts to\\u00a0outline the value exchange\\u00a0in recognition of the clinical and other expertise they contribute to activities, particularly those in a pre-commercial phase.
  • Creation of jobs and opportunities within the UK: we aim for digital health innovationto result in a\\u00a0significant contribution to the UK economy\\u00a0and to its strategic focus on data driven technologies including the AI sector. Those who we work with will actively commit to look for opportunities to do this. This will clearly range given the differing size and reach of digital innovators, but examples would include: creation of new jobs and services within the UK; the headquartering of a head office or R&D facility; or investment in software engineering and machine-learning skills at leading universities. When these opportunities are realised, to agree that we publish them in line with our expectations of transparency set out above.
\", \"id\": \"0844a5f5-5ecd-4bbe-8227-a43398ad5331\"}]"}

{"pk": 11, "path": "0001000100040004", "depth": 4, "numchild": 0, "title": "Get involved", "draft_title": "Get involved", "slug": "get-involved", "content_type": 33, "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": false, "url_path": "/home/about-us/get-involved/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "locked_at": null, "locked_by": null, "first_published_at": "2020-04-07T13:13:27.368Z", "last_published_at": "2020-04-07T13:13:27.368Z", "latest_revision_created_at": "2020-04-07T13:13:27.321Z", "live_revision": 28, "page_links": "[]", "automatic": true, "fb_og_image": null, "fb_og_title": null, "fb_og_description": null, "twitter_card_image": null, "twitter_card_title": null, "twitter_card_alt_text": null, "twitter_card_description": null, "body": "[{\"type\": \"rich_text\", \"value\": \"

Please get in touch.

We are keen to hear from everyone who is affected by the technology we use in health and care, from patients to technologists and innovators to carers to clinicians.

We are currently seeking views on an\\u00a0NHS Digital Health Technology Standard\\u00a0and our\\u00a0tech plan for health and care.

Engaging with digital health innovators

On 4 July 2019, NHSX held a listening event for innovators working in healthtech, in partnership with the Accelerated Access Collaborative, the Academic Health Science Network, the Office for Life Sciences and techUK. At the event, we asked the innovators what NHSX's priorities shouldbe. This\\u00a0digital innovators summary report\\u00a0details the key themes that emerged and how we are responding to them.

We run monthly surgeries for digital innovators to meet with members of our Digital Innovation Team. These provide us with the opportunity to learn more about you and your product; and for you to ask us for advice on issues, such as scaling within the NHS. If you would like to register for a surgery, please fill in this\\u00a0innovator application form.

How to make a Freedom of Information request to NHSX

NHSX is a joint unit between NHS England and Improvement and the Department for Health and Social Care. All requests for information should be directed to\\u00a0NHS England and Improvement\\u00a0in the first instance.

If your request needs information from the Department of Health and Social Care we will forward on your request. This will not impact the Freedom of Information timeframe.

Got something to say? Contact us

  • Twitter:\\u00a0follow us at @NHSX
  • Email:\\u00a0feedback@nhsx.nhs.uk
\", \"id\": \"157612bd-fb3a-46c4-a7e4-8f954dafb600\"}]"}

{"pk": 7, "path": "000100010004", "depth": 3, "numchild": 4, "title": "About us", "draft_title": "About us","slug": "about-us", "content_type": 34, "live": true, "has_unpublished_changes": false, "url_path": "/home/about-us/", "owner": 1, "seo_title": "", "show_in_menus": false, "search_description": "", "go_live_at": null, "expire_at": null, "expired": false, "locked": false, "locked_at": null, "locked_by": null, "first_published_at": "2020-04-07T12:54:47.913Z", "last_published_at": "2020-04-09T11:44:51.031Z", "latest_revision_created_at": "2020-04-09T11:44:50.936Z", "live_revision": 121, "page_links": "[]", "automatic": true, "fb_og_image": null, "fb_og_title": null, "fb_og_description": null, "twitter_card_image": null, "twitter_card_title": null, "twitter_card_alt_text": null, "twitter_card_description": null, "headline": null, "sub_head": null, "image": null, "body": "[{\"type\": \"rich_text\", \"value\": \"
